sentences.sContent: Madame Curie will always be remembered as the discoverer of radium.
sentences.sContent_eng: Madame Curie will always be remembered as the discoverer of radium.
sentences.sCn: 居里夫人作为镭的发现者将永远为人们所怀念。

sentences.sContent: In general, comets are named after their discoverer, either a person.
sentences.sContent_eng: In general, comets are named after their discoverer, either a person.
sentences.sCn: 总的来说，彗星是以发现者，或者说是人的名字命名的。

sentences.sContent: The Mozart’s frog’s whistle-like call resembles musical notes when mapped as an audiospectrogram, a fact that inspired discoverer Blair Hedges to name the species after the famed composer.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Mozart’s frog’s whistle-like call resembles musical notes when mapped as an audiospectrogram, a fact that inspired discoverer Blair Hedges to name the species after the famed composer.
sentences.sCn: 莫扎特蛙口哨般的叫声在声谱图上的反应就像音符一般，受此启发，发现者布莱尔·赫齐斯用那著名的作曲家的名字给这个物种命名。

words.tran: 发现，发觉；被发现的事物
